alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:39PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...River Flooding is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following county, Sussex. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding is expected to occur along the Nottoway River at Stony Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 831 PM EST, the Nottoway River at Stony Creek continues to rise after recent heavy rainfall. The river has risen above minor flood stage and is expected to continue to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet around 1 AM tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - For Nottoway River at Stony Creek: At 7:30pm the stage was 15.7 feet. Flood Stage is 15.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 16.0 feet is expected at 1:00am Tuesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
